methods.name: coord_seq
methods.docstring: "Return a clone of the coordinate sequence for this Geometry."

methods.name: geom_type
methods.docstring: "Return a string representing the Geometry type, e.g. 'Polygon'"

methods.name: geom_typeid
methods.docstring: "Return an integer representing the Geometry type."

methods.name: num_geom
methods.docstring: "Return the number of geometries in the Geometry."

methods.name: num_coords
methods.docstring: "Return the number of coordinates in the Geometry."

methods.name: num_points
methods.docstring: "Return the number points, or coordinates, in the Geometry."

methods.name: dims
methods.docstring: "Return the dimension of this Geometry (0=point, 1=line, 2=surface)."

methods.name: normalize
methods.docstring: "Convert this Geometry to normal form (or canonical form)."

methods.name: empty
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return a boolean indicating whether the set of points in this Geometry
        are empty.
        """

methods.name: hasz
methods.docstring: "Return whether the geometry has a 3D dimension."

methods.name: ring
methods.docstring: "Return whether or not the geometry is a ring."

methods.name: simple
methods.docstring: "Return false if the Geometry isn't simple."

methods.name: valid
methods.docstring: "Test the validity of this Geometry."

methods.name: valid_reason
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return a string containing the reason for any invalidity.
        """

methods.name: contains
methods.docstring: "Return true if other.within(this) returns true."

methods.name: covers
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return True if the DE-9IM Intersection Matrix for the two geometries is
        T*****FF*, *T****FF*, ***T**FF*, or ****T*FF*. If either geometry is
        empty, return False.
        """

methods.name: crosses
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the two Geometries
        is T*T****** (for a point and a curve,a point and an area or a line and
        an area) 0******** (for two curves).
        """

methods.name: disjoint
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the two Geometries
        is FF*FF****.
        """

methods.name: equals
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the two Geometries
        is T*F**FFF*.
        """

methods.name: equals_exact
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the two Geometries are exactly equal, up to a
        specified tolerance.
        """

methods.name: intersects
methods.docstring: "Return true if disjoint return false."

methods.name: overlaps
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the two Geometries
        is T*T***T** (for two points or two surfaces) 1*T***T** (for two curves).
        """

methods.name: relate_pattern
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the elements in the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the
        two Geometries match the elements in pattern.
        """

methods.name: touches
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the two Geometries
        is FT*******, F**T***** or F***T****.
        """

methods.name: within
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return true if the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the two Geometries
        is T*F**F***.
        """

methods.name: srid
methods.docstring: "Get the SRID for the geometry. Return None if no SRID is set."

methods.name: srid
methods.docstring: "Set the SRID for the geometry."

methods.name: ewkt
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the EWKT (SRID + WKT) of the Geometry.
        """

methods.name: wkt
methods.docstring: "Return the WKT (Well-Known Text) representation of this Geometry."

methods.name: hex
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the WKB of this Geometry in hexadecimal form. Please note
        that the SRID is not included in this representation because it is not
        a part of the OGC specification (use the `hexewkb` property instead).
        """

methods.name: hexewkb
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the EWKB of this Geometry in hexadecimal form. This is an
        extension of the WKB specification that includes SRID value that are
        a part of this geometry.
        """

methods.name: json
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return GeoJSON representation of this Geometry.
        """

methods.name: wkb
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the WKB (Well-Known Binary) representation of this Geometry
        as a Python buffer.  SRID and Z values are not included, use the
        `ewkb` property instead.
        """

methods.name: ewkb
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the EWKB representation of this Geometry as a Python buffer.
        This is an extension of the WKB specification that includes any SRID
        value that are a part of this geometry.
        """

methods.name: kml
methods.docstring: "Return the KML representation of this Geometry."

methods.name: prepared
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return a PreparedGeometry corresponding to this geometry -- it is
        optimized for the contains, intersects, and covers operations.
        """

methods.name: ogr
methods.docstring: "Return the OGR Geometry for this Geometry."

methods.name: srs
methods.docstring: "Return the OSR SpatialReference for SRID of this Geometry."

methods.name: crs
methods.docstring: "Alias for `srs` property."

methods.name: transform
methods.docstring:
"""
        Requires GDAL. Transform the geometry according to the given
        transformation object, which may be an integer SRID, and WKT or
        PROJ string. By default, transform the geometry in-place and return
        nothing. However if the `clone` keyword is set, don't modify the
        geometry and return a transformed clone instead.
        """

methods.name: boundary
methods.docstring: "Return the boundary as a newly allocated Geometry object."

methods.name: buffer
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return a geometry that represents all points whose distance from this
        Geometry is less than or equal to distance. Calculations are in the
        Spatial Reference System of this Geometry. The optional third parameter sets
        the number of segment used to approximate a quarter circle (defaults to 8).
        (Text from PostGIS documentation at ch. 6.1.3)
        """

methods.name: buffer_with_style
methods.docstring:
"""
        Same as buffer() but allows customizing the style of the buffer.

        End cap style can be round (1), flat (2), or square (3).
        Join style can be round (1), mitre (2), or bevel (3).
        Mitre ratio limit only affects mitered join style.
        """

methods.name: centroid
methods.docstring:
"""
        The centroid is equal to the centroid of the set of component Geometries
        of highest dimension (since the lower-dimension geometries contribute zero
        "weight" to the centroid).
        """

methods.name: convex_hull
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the smallest convex Polygon that contains all the points
        in the Geometry.
        """

methods.name: difference
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return a Geometry representing the points making up this Geometry
        that do not make up other.
        """

methods.name: envelope
methods.docstring: "Return the envelope for this geometry (a polygon)."

methods.name: intersection
methods.docstring: "Return a Geometry representing the points shared by this Geometry and other."

methods.name: point_on_surface
methods.docstring: "Compute an interior point of this Geometry."

methods.name: relate
methods.docstring: "Return the DE-9IM intersection matrix for this Geometry and the other."

methods.name: simplify
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the Geometry, simplified using the Douglas-Peucker algorithm
        to the specified tolerance (higher tolerance => less points).  If no
        tolerance provided, defaults to 0.

        By default, don't preserve topology - e.g. polygons can be split,
        collapse to lines or disappear holes can be created or disappear, and
        lines can cross. By specifying preserve_topology=True, the result will
        have the same dimension and number of components as the input. This is
        significantly slower.
        """

methods.name: sym_difference
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return a set combining the points in this Geometry not in other,
        and the points in other not in this Geometry.
        """

methods.name: unary_union
methods.docstring: "Return the union of all the elements of this geometry."

methods.name: union
methods.docstring: "Return a Geometry representing all the points in this Geometry and other."

methods.name: area
methods.docstring: "Return the area of the Geometry."

methods.name: distance
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the distance between the closest points on this Geometry
        and the other. Units will be in those of the coordinate system of
        the Geometry.
        """

methods.name: extent
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the extent of this geometry as a 4-tuple, consisting of
        (xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax).
        """

methods.name: length
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the length of this Geometry (e.g., 0 for point, or the
        circumference of a Polygon).
        """

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: "Clone this Geometry."

methods.name: merged
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return the line merge of this Geometry.
        """

methods.name: closed
methods.docstring:
"""
        Return whether or not this Geometry is closed.
        """

classes.name: GEOSGeometry
classes.docstring: "A class that, generally, encapsulates a GEOS geometry."

doc:
"""
 This module contains the 'base' GEOSGeometry object -- all GEOS Geometries
 inherit from this object.
"""
